titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Jamaica and Mexico City Field Office Files
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Jamaica and Mexico City Field Office Files FA612

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-17 18:10:04 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Latin America and the Caribbean, Jamaica and Mexico City Field Office Files

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, John S. Nagel files, reports, subject files, grant and proposal files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 5 series by file type.
Series I. Chronological Correspondence Files, 1970 January-September
Series II. John S. Nagel (LAC Representative) Desk Files, 1966-1973
Series V. Grant and Proposal Files, 1962-1974

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ford Foundation maintained an office in Kingston, Jamaica from 1967 to 1970. The Kingston office administered the Foundation's program for Jamaica and the Caribbean region.

By 1979, the Foundation had issued over $13 million in grants for the Caribbean. The majority of the Foundation's Caribbean grantmaking focused on Jamaica, but it also provided support to the Domincan Republic, Barbados, and Trinidad. After it closed its Kingson office in 1970, the Foundation transferred responsibility for its Caribbean program to its Mexico City, Mexico office. The Foundation reduced its grantmaking to the Caribbean in the 1970s (The Ford Foundation in the Caribbean discussion notes, 1979, Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 13949-17726 (FA739F), Report 016709).
